job requisition id
JR102328
Tricon Residential is an owner and operator of a growing portfolio of more than 38,000 single-family rental homes in the U.S. Sun Belt and multi-family apartments in Canada. Our commitment to enriching the lives of our employees, residents and local communities underpins Tricon’s culture and business philosophy. We provide high-quality rental housing options for families across the United States and Canada through our technology-enabled operating platform and dedicated on-the-ground operating teams. Our development programs are also delivering thousands of new rental homes and apartments as part of our commitment to help solve the housing supply shortage. At Tricon, we imagine a world where housing unlocks life’s potential.
Job Description
The Financial Analyst will play a critical role in supporting our residential development platform’s growth through financial modeling, investment analysis, and strategic acquisitions, as well as supporting our sustainability program. Key responsibilities include conducting financial analyses for existing and new investments, preparing detailed investment presentations, contributing to the research and analysis of new acquisitions and key sustainability initiatives, and collaborating with cross-functional teams, will demonstrate strong financial acumen, effective communication skills, and the ability to adapt in a dynamic environment.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following but are not limited to the job specifications contained herein. Additional duties or job functions that can be performed safely may be required as deemed necessary by supervisory personnel.
Financial Modeling & Analysis: Execute financial modeling and data analysis to support acquisitions, market research, asset/portfolio management, and sustainability initiatives
Investment Presentations: Support the creation and delivery of thoughtful and detail-oriented investment materials, working with internal and external parties to synthesize information into investment proposals, project reforecasts, market studies, and recommendations on various investment or sustainability initiatives
Investment Management: Assist in the investment management and reporting for Tricon's US residential development portfolio by creating and updating management reports, identifying variances to project plans, and crafting insightful commentary/recommendations
Budgeting & Reforecasting: Contribute to the detailed budgeting and reforecasting of Tricon’s build-to-rent business line by leveraging available data to justify operating assumptions and update complex financial models
Acquisitions: Support the screening, underwriting, and execution of new build-to-rent communities or other real estate or sustainability investments
Sustainability: Develop a scalable sustainability data management system, create and track KPIs, and drive sustainability efforts through analysis, summary document preparation, and reporting
Market & Economic Insights: Track and analyze market and economic trends to inform investment strategies and business decisions
Cross-Department Collaboration: Collaborate with asset management, development, and reporting teams to gather information and achieve business goals
Dynamic Attitude and Adaptability: Demonstrate flexibility and adaptability in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment
Qualifications:
Analytical Mindset: Ability to conduct detailed and accurate analyses with confidence, attention to detail, and pride in work product
Technical Proficiency: Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word and a strong desire to perfect financial, data modeling, and presentation preparation skills
Financial Acumen: Understanding of financial modeling, finance, and accounting concepts
Initiative-taking: Adaptable, with a positive and “can-do" attitude, ability to multitask and perform in a highly dynamic workplace environment
Data-driven: Capable of aggregating and analyzing large, often disorganized, data from disparate sources and create sound outputs providing actionable business insights and recommendations
Collaborator: Collaborative, with a positive attitude towards teamwork and problem-solving
Effective Communicator: Strong written and oral communication skills, maintaining professionalism in high-stakes situations
Problem Solver: Persistence in accomplishing challenging goals with innate problem-solving abilities
Resilience: Ability to accept constructive criticism and quickly learn from mistakes
Task Management: Excellent prioritization skills and ability to work under tight deadlines
Minimum Requirements:
Minimum qualifications for the typical candidate to be successful in the role.
Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, economics, or real estate with very strong performance preferred
1-3 years of work or internship experience in investment banking, consulting, corporate finance, or real estate investments / asset management
Inherent sense of curiosity and a drive to seek out knowledge.
Strong business acumen and organizational leadership skills
Excellent interpersonal skills including patience, flexibility, consideration, discretion, tact, confidence, and effectiveness in dealing with people
Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job, including:
Frequently required to sit; talk; and hear.
Occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and stoop; kneel; or crouch.
Occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.
Vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and depth perception.

By embracing these principles, we aim to positively impact our business and the communities we serve, creating a lasting legacy where everyone can thrive.

Placement within this compensation range will be determined by the candidate's knowledge, experience and skills.

title: Financial Analyst

description:
EOE STATEMENT
We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION
Calvary Robotics is a world leader in the design, build and development of custom turnkey automation solutions, robotics platforms and material handling systems, as well as a predominant integrator of third party technology and equipment.

POSITION
Financial Analyst

DESCRIPTION
This role focuses on ensuring organizations receive accurate, relevant and timely financial data and analytics to facilitate proactive decision making to support the business. The position reports directly to the Controller and will work across the finance team and cross-functionally on various analysis, projections, operating budgets, and reconciliations as appropriate. Specific responsibility includes financial planning, reporting and some general accounting in support of the sales, manufacturing and other activities of the Calvary businesses. Position consolidates data and provides site leadership with an overview of financial performance by analyzing performance utilizing various applications, tools and procedures Included are support of operational matters related to management and reporting of monthly financial statements, budgeting, audit coordination, and internal controls and compliance.
Financial Analysis and Planning
Analyzes and interprets data to support the performance of the company by providing relevant, reliable and timely reporting of the historical performance in order to drive and influence future performance.
Provides effective and timely analysis of Indirect spending to help facilitate proactive decision-making.
Participates in monthly review meetings.
Oversees inputs to monthly forecasting.
Manages various data inputs and files utilized in the reporting process.
Participates in monthly financial close through timely posting of general ledger entries, account reconciliations, headcount and reporting analytics and communication of performance.
Participates in Cash Flow analysis as required by leadership and the bank by analyzing changes in receivables and payables. Able to answer questions about Cash Flow.
Consolidate data to provide senior leadership with an overview of financial performance.
Provides departmental budget support and analysis of monthly performance.
Works closely with Controller to support and serve as backup in select areas.
Provides ad hoc analytical and planning assistance as necessary to partially include; Process Improvements, Financial Efficiencies and Operational Improvements.
Ensure all work instructions and procedures are up to date
Responsible for supporting Budget / Forecast / Financial Planning activities.
Serves as focal point for Headcount budgeting, forecasting, reporting and analysis.
Provides detailed analysis and understanding of the budget in responsible areas including comparison to prior year, prior forecast, and overall company trends. Highlights and recommends areas for improvement which may assist in site and/or departmental goal setting.
ERP Finance Modules Used Effectively
Serve as a resource for simple system functionality and business process questions.
Troubleshoots ERP-related problems and works with IT and 3P support organization on problems that need resolution from a system perspective.
Identifies process and/or configuration changes that could improve how the system supports the business.
The salary range for this role is $85,000 to $98,000; however, Calvary Robotics considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role ans associated responsibilities, an applicants work experience, education/training and key skills. Should you have compensation expectations that exceed this range, we would love to hear from and you would welcome you to reach out to further discuss


POSITION REQUIREMENTS
REQUIRED EDUCATION:
Bachelor’s Degree required.
QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE:
Five Years + in manufacturing environment working in a finance capacity.
Five Years + experience with business systems, database applications and visual reporting.

FULL-TIME/PART-TIME
-unspecified-

EXEMPT/NON-EXEMPT
Non-Exempt


LOCATION



THIS POSITION IS CURRENTLY ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS.

description:
Residential Construction / Home Builder Career Opportunity
We are seeking a skilled Financial Analyst to join our client’s expanding team in Raleigh, NC.
This role is ideal for professionals with a solid financial background looking to contribute to a high-growth, results-driven environment. The position analyzes financial data, prepares detailed reports, and provides strategic insights to support business decisions and drive company performance.
Our client values individuals who excel in data analysis, forecasting, and financial modeling to help optimize profitability and improve operational efficiency.
Job Highlights:
Financial Analysis: Perform detailed financial analyses, identifying key trends, variances, and opportunities for improved performance.
Budgeting & Forecasting: Lead the preparation of budgets and forecasts to guide financial planning and business strategy.
Reporting: Generate accurate and timely financial reports for management, offering insights that support decision-making.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with operations, sales, and leadership departments to ensure alignment on financial goals and business objectives.
Financial Analyst Responsibilities
Develops and manages comprehensive reports for monthly forecasting, financial reporting, and the annual budgeting cycle, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery.
Monitors and analyzes key performance indicators (KPIs) on a monthly basis, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.
Assists in the development and optimization of new financial projects within Hyperion, enhancing system functionality and user experience.
Serves as the main point of contact for Hyperion inquiries from the field, prioritizing, researching, and resolving issues promptly while keeping all stakeholders informed of progress and outcomes.
Oversees the production and distribution of key financial reports, including Forecast Books, Management Packs, and Budget documents, ensuring consistency and accessibility.
Continuously evaluates and refines financial processes and reporting structures to identify and implement efficiency improvements.
Performs ad-hoc financial modeling and in-depth analyses to support strategic decision-making and enhance business outcomes.
Financial Analyst Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or a related field.
1-2 years of relevant finance experience.
Proficient in financial modeling with strong analytical skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication abilities.
Highly organized and detail-oriented, with experience supporting management reporting and budgeting processes.
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and manage multiple tasks efficiently.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Experience with Hyperion and Essbase is preferred.
Premier Homebuilding Benefits
Attractive Compensation Package: Benefit from a robust salary structure complemented by a lucrative company bonus opportunity.
Comprehensive Health Benefits: Avail top-tier medical, dental, vision, and prescription drug coverage for peace of mind.
Retirement Security: Contribute to a 401(k) plan and watch your savings grow for a secured future.
Protection Against Uncertainties: Robust disability programs in place, ensuring your well-being during unexpected challenges.
Life Insurance: Comprehensive coverage for employees and their dependents, ensuring financial security for your loved ones.
Work-Life Balance: Enjoy ample vacation time and observe company holidays to rejuvenate and spend quality time with loved ones.

description:
Senior Advisor, Supervision- Financial Analyst (Remote Option Available) -2403137
Description

Department Overview:
Raymond James Financial is a Florida-based diversified holding company, headquartered in St. Petersburg, FL. Raymond James provides financial services to individuals, corporations and municipalities through its subsidiary companies engaged primarily in investment and financial planning, in addition to capital markets and asset management.
The Supervision department partners closely with the business to proactively mitigate risk. Our department supports business units by managing activity/account reviews, product oversight, escalation/approvals and governance guided by specialized knowledge. Supervision is committed to supporting and protecting clients and the firm while preserving our culture, and adhering to our core values of client first, conservatism, independence and integrity.
At Raymond James, we are putting the power of perspectives into action and building an inclusive and diverse workforce that reflects our commitment to associates, and clients of the future. Our company values associate development and growth, offering opportunities through developmental programs, mentorships, and continuing education options.
Job Summary:

The Transformation & Strategy team uses knowledge and skills obtained through education, experience, specialized training and/or certification to manage multiple projects simultaneously, both large in size and broad in scope with an emphasis on data gathering, analysis and projections.
The ideal candidate will use extensive knowledge and skills obtained through education, experience, or specialized training to support the broader Supervision and Transformation & Strategy team. The associate will partner with stakeholders across Supervision to support, define and implement high-quality, data-driven reporting, support strategic initiatives, and complete complex assignments.
Additionally, under general supervision, uses knowledge and skills to manage financial metrics and professionally report to management. Guidance is provided to perform varied reporting functions with responsibility for making non-routine decisions. Regular contact with senior management and other internal customers is required to identify, research, and resolve cost allocation issues.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Gathers data from various sources to perform trending analysis and other ad-hoc reporting.
Accurately maintain models and prepare summary reports as requested.
Support team to plan, develop, and execute initiatives in Supervision functions.
Analyzes results and presents them in a business-friendly manner.
May plan, assign, and collaborate with the work of other associates.
Balances conflicting resource and priority demands.
Assist with Ad-hoc data inquiries and requests; conduct research/analysis and effectively communicate findings.
Develops, prepares, presents, and maintains project plans including staffing requirements, cost estimates, and work breakdown structures and schedules.
Leads departmental teams to provide job related input to ensure all relevant information is considered
Identifies costs and develops methodology for accurate allocation across the organization
Prepares management reports in a format that can be quickly reviewed by management
Prepares Supervision economic models to assist in advisor recruiting decisions
Reviews, evaluates and implements process improvements, as appropriate
Identifies potential impact of new departments, subsidiaries, products and other changes on job responsibilities
Coordinates with management on the presentation and preparation of internal management reports that can be quickly reviewed by management
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned
Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Knowledge of:
Concepts, practices, and procedures of project management.
Concepts, principles, and procedures or securities industry and/or banking compliance or related fields.
Advanced Financial Reporting concepts, practices and procedures
Basic accounting principals
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
General office practices, procedures, and methods
General financial markets and products knowledge

Skill in:
Data analysis
Effective communication and presentation skills
Strong organization, planning, and time management.
Fluent in Microsoft Office applications –Excel (Lookups, Pivot Tables, Formulas, Macros etc.), PowerPoint, Visio, Word.
Advanced skills in Excel including knowledge of complex formulas and managing large data sets
Analyzing financial information
Performing mathematical calculations
Operating standard office equipment and using required software applications, including word processing, spreadsheets and data bases
Clear and concise written and verbal communication as well as ability to create effective presentations

Ability to:
Organize, self-manage, and track multiple detailed projects and responsibilities with frequently changing priorities in a fast-paced work environment
Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
Learn new software tools and systems thoroughly and efficiently.
Lead meetings and contribute to team efforts by ensuring all relevant information is included in the outcomes
Implement changes to standard procedures when required by specific situations and circumstances
Work independently, make non-routine decisions and resolve moderately complex accounting problems
Attend to detail while maintaining a big picture orientation.
Balance conflicting resource and priority demands.
Gather information, identify linkages and trends and apply findings to assignments.
Work under pressure on multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines in a fast-paced work environment with frequent interruptions and changing priorities.
Use appropriate interpersonal styles and communicate effectively, both orally and writing, with all organizational levels.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships at all levels of the organization.
Work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment.
Educational/Previous Experience Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree (B.A) in a related discipline and a minimum of three (3) years of relevant experience
~or~
An equivalent combination of experience, education, and/or training.
Licenses/Certifications:
None Required
Raymond James Guiding Behaviors
At Raymond James our associates use five guiding behaviors (Develop, Collaborate, Decide, Deliver, Improve) to deliver on the firm's core values of client-first, integrity, independence and a conservative, long-term view.

We expect our associates at all levels to:
Grow professionally and inspire others to do the same

Make prompt, pragmatic choices and act with the client in mind

Contribute to the continuous evolution of the firm
At Raymond James – as part of our people-first culture, we honor, value, and respect the uniqueness, experiences, and backgrounds of all of our Associates. When associates bring their best authentic selves, our organization, clients, and communities thrive. description:
Financial Analyst
Position Title: Financial Analyst
Company: Harrison Poultry
Location: Bethlehem, GA
Employment Type: Full Time/Salaried
Compensation: Up to $75,000/year (depending on experience) base salary; 15% Annual Bonus Target

Position Summary:
Harrison Poultry is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Financial Analyst to support our live and plant operations. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of accounting principles, be proficient in financial analysis, and can work both independently and within cross-functional teams. This role focuses on financial planning, budgeting, and reporting, with opportunities for growth within the company.

Key Responsibilities:
Analyze financial statements, market trends, and operations to identify areas for cost savings.
Assist in budgeting, forecasting, and monitoring financial performance.
Prepare detailed financial reports and presentations for management.
Analyze production costs, inventory levels, and supply chain expenses to recommend cost-saving initiatives and improve efficiency.
Develop financial models to support business planning and strategic projects.
Ensure financial practices comply with internal policies and external regulations. Assist with audits and financial reviews.
Work with other departments to provide financial insights and support decision-making processes.

Skills & Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
2-5 years of experience in finance, preferably in the manufacturing or food processing industry.
Experience with accounting software (Dynamics GP strongly preferred).
Experience with Power BI is a plus.
Strong understanding of basic accounting principles.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other Office applications.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Work Environment:
The position is based in an office setting within the poultry processing facility.
May occasionally require visits to the production floor to collaborate with operations teams.
Standard working hours with occasional overtime during peak periods (e.g., month-end close).

Equal Opportunity Employer:
Harrison Poultry is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

description:
The Financial Analyst assists in managing the fiscal components of department and program contracts at the agency. Supports financial decision-making, conducts financial & data analysis, performs financial modeling and reporting, ensures accurate financial forecasts, identifies opportunities for cost optimization, and provides insight for agency management. Acts as a liaison to CII program management and government funding agencies to meet contract fiscal and compliance requirements.
DUTIES
SUMMARY
The Financial Analyst assists in managing the fiscal components of department and program contracts at the agency. Supports financial decision-making, conducts financial & data analysis, performs financial modeling and reporting, ensures accurate financial forecasts, identifies opportunities for cost optimization, and provides insight for agency management. Acts as a liaison to CII program management and government funding agencies to meet contract fiscal and compliance requirements.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Manages government and foundation grants/contracts and budgets ranging between $1M-$15M. and prepares accurate and timely financial reports and provides key insights to management for decision-making purposes.
Assists in developing financial budgets, forecasts, and models to support strategic planning and resource allocation considering historical performance and future growth projections.
Monitors actual financial performance by conducting in-depth financial analysis explaining and providing insights, including variance & trend analysis and financial performance assessments to support business recommendations.
Collaborates with program management to support the development or revision of program budgets, refunding applications throughout the year.
Tracks, monitors, compares, and analyzes revenues, expenses, amounts billed, payments received, payroll labor distributions, cost allocations, revenue, and expense accruals to contract/grant budgets to ensure compliance and ensuring adherence to budgets and cost containment.
Analyzes program costs and manages invoices to program funders.
Provides support with cost optimization and efficiency improvement analysis activities.
ADDITIONAL DUTIES
Other duties and special projects as assigned.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
This job has no supervisory responsibilities.
QUALIFICATIONS
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, or Accounting required.
2+ years of finance experience. Non-profit experience is a plus.
Advanced financial modeling & analytical skills.
Experience creating forecasts and providing recommendations to upper management.
Familiarity with federal government contracts.
OTHER QUALIFICATIONS
Strong task prioritization and process improvement.
Reliable transportation to and from the worksite.
May require some travel.
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to research and find answers for unknown variables.
Maintains patient privacy, including protecting confidentiality, safeguarding the integrity and availability, and limiting the use and disclosure of patient Protected Health Information (PHI) to authorized individuals and entities.
Participates in, conducts, and sustains performance quality improvement activities according to designated roles and responsibilities.
Sensitivity to service population’s cultural and socioeconomic characteristics.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Punctual and dependable attendance.
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
None required.
COMPUTER SKILLS
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite 365 (Word, Excel, Outlook, and Teams)
Adaptive Insights experience a plus.

title: Financial Analyst

description:
Description:
Are you ready to dive into the dynamic world of finance? As a Financial Analyst, you’ll be at the forefront of launching and managing innovative debt funds and securitizations. You’ll build and optimize critical operational functions, ensuring seamless loan executions, compliance, and top-notch service.
Requirements:

After one year as our Financial Analyst, you will know you were successful if you …
Interacted with Loan Officers/Originators and Underwriters to track progress of loans in pipeline.
Interacted with Merchants Capital’s asset management team to monitor the performance of portfolio loans after closing.
Maintained loan pipeline.
Worked with closing and fund legal teams to purchase loans.
Interfaced with investors and warehouse facilities to finance loans.
Gathered monthly and quarterly property level data to aggregate and synthesize reports to investors.
Created short form credit memos for the investment committee.
Ensured compliance with fund level underwriting parameters.
Engaged in discussions around risks and risk mitigants with committee members.
What we are looking for…
Ability to work independently and autonomously required.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail required.
Bachelor’s degree in finance or related field, or equivalent professional experience, required.
Strong interest in learning and experiencing finance, structured products, agency (FNMA/FHLMC) and HUD lending, and fund management required.
Intermediate level proficiency in Microsoft Excel required.
ABOUT MERCHANTS CAPITAL
With over 30 years of success built on putting people first, Merchants Capital is a proven leader in financing for multi-family housing nationwide. Our licenses with Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, and HUD/FHA, in addition to our bank’s balance sheet products, allow us to offer custom solutions with agility and ease of execution, expanding access to housing in meaningful and impactful ways. Recognized as a top five affordable lender, Merchants Capital pairs our comprehensive debt offerings with in-house tax credit equity to provide a one-stop-shop for developers and owners. To learn more about Merchants Capital, visit www.merchantscapital.com.
title: Financial Analyst

description:
The Financial Analyst will collaborate with every team at Follett to perform financial analysis, generate budgets and forecasts, and build financial and operating models to support key tactical and strategic decisions for the company.
Prepare templates, facilitate meetings, and provide guidance and support to organization for monthly financial and management reviews. This includes understanding major variances impacting the P&L and FCF and summarize for high level business presentations
Own internal monthly reporting and variance reviews for different functions of the business including but not limited to Revenue, SG&A, EBITDA & Balance Sheet. Reconcile, validate, and ensure consistency of data from submitted to Financial Reporting system
Drive continuous process improvements in reporting, forecasting, and budgeting activities through automation, system enhancements, data quality, consolidation, and quality improvement
Bubble up relevant and timely analysis and insight to management, seeking to connect the dots in the data and prepare and analyze special projects as assigned
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree (B.S.) in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or Computer Information Systems
2+ years of experience in an analytical role in corporate finance/accounting (PE experience a plus)
Experience in Netsuite, PBCS, or other financial reporting and dashboarding systems
Experience building financial models forecasting Income Statements, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow
Advanced knowledge of Excel and Power Point financial modeling concepts
Strong financial acumen, including understanding of all financial statements, KPIs, Adj. EBITDA, and focus on important drivers and how to prioritize drivers
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment and need assistance or an accommodation in the application process due to a disability, please contact us by email or phone.

#130631 Research Admin. Financial Analyst
Extended Deadline: Tue 10/1/2024

UC San Diego values equity, diversity, and inclusion. If you are interested in being part of our team, possess the needed licensure and certifications, and feel that you have most of the qualifications and/or transferable skills for a job opening, we strongly encourage you to apply.

UCSD Layoff from Career Appointment: Apply by 07/0/2024 for consideration with preference for rehire. All layoff applicants should contact their Employment Advisor.
Special Selection Applicants: Apply by 07/12/2024 Eligible Special Selection clients should contact their Disability Counselor for assistance.
This position will work a hybrid schedule which includes a combination of working both onsite on Campus and remote.
DESCRIPTION
UCSD Health Sciences is a $1 billion dollar plus organization encompassing 17 academic departments (15 clinical, 2 basic sciences), 2 preacademic/hospital departments, 2 professional schools (School of Medicine and Skaggs School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences), 2 hospitals, and various other programs and units all dedicated towards fulfilling the Health Sciences missions. The UCSD Department of Cellular and Molecular Medicine (CMM) is one of two basic science units in the School of Medicine where world-class researchers study fundamental cellular processes and pathways using a variety of techniques from classical genetics and fluorescence microscopy to high throughput genomics, systems biology, and crystallography. Our 37 faculty and over 200 postdoctoral scholars, graduate students, and research staff work on the cutting edge of biology, cutting across fields from basic biochemistry and genetics to genomics, systems biology and stem cell biology. The faculty also play a major role in medical and graduate student training, providing educational and programmatic offerings that span several disciplines and provide diversity to meet the interests of a broad spectrum of students and scholars. The diverse mix of ages, backgrounds, and talents creates a robust work environment with challenging career opportunities and a commitment to continued growth potential. We constantly seek to recruit highly motivated, technologically advanced, and deeply interested individuals who are ready to become a part of our dynamic research and educational environment.
Uses skills as a seasoned and experienced pre and post award research administrator to independently prepare and manage research proposals, awards and transactions related to contract and grant management, and maintain contract and grant records in compliance with institutional research sponsor policies. Under minimal supervision, the incumbent performs full proposal development, administration, and analytical and strategic reporting for a multi-PI proposal portfolio. This position requires exceptional customer service skills.
Pre award support will be required for all funding mechanisms and all sponsors. Assignments include multiple PI's, department recharge centers, multiple funding sources, multiple institutions, and multiple sites. Manages proposals and awards of diverse scope where analysis of data requires thorough understanding of complex regulations and requirements. Completes and approves transactions for signature by manager or other authorized institutional official.
Comprehensive post award management includes using strong analytical skills for allocation and expense monitoring, understanding of agency-specific requirements, detailed and timely reporting, and advisement to faculty. All post award transactions will be supported by this position.
Supports CMM's annual budget process by providing reports of pending funding and effort. Supports faculty in compliance with E-Cert.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Seven (7) years of related experience or a Bachelor's degree in a related area plus three (3) years of related experience.
Thorough understanding of research administration guidelines of Federal and non-Federal sponsors supporting research and educational activities, preferably in a university environment. Demonstrated ability to evaluate RFP and RFA language of sponsors to diplomatically advise investigators of sponsor requirements. Proven efficiency and accuracy in the preparation grant budgets of all types. Demonstrated understanding of the grant proposal process from inception to completion. Familiarity with federal, state, and private agency contract and grant regulations.
Thorough knowledge of applicable compliance requirements related to use of human or animal subjects in research, financial conflict of interest, biosafety, etc.
Ability to manage significant volume of transactions. Skill in prioritizing a high volume workload to ensure priorities and other deadlines are met. Demonstrated ability to work in pressure situations to meet deadlines and accommodate interruptions. Ability to maintain flexibility to redirect efforts when priorities change. Competence with all transaction functions including purchasing, account reconciliation, accounts payable and receivable systems, and eCERT.
Ability to perform complex financial analysis and customized reporting. Ability to provide comprehensive and effective post award reporting, working directly with faculty to manage funding per sponsor requirements. Ability to analyze expenditures, recognize trends and support budget justifications consistent with agency requirements.
Demonstrated competence in the use of spreadsheet and database software in financial analysis, fiscal management and financial reports. Experience in budget preparation using automated spreadsheet systems. Must be an early adopter of UCSD Coeus Proposal Development system. Demonstrated skill in using a variety of computer systems, including spreadsheet, database, word-processing, and Internet systems. Must have demonstrated expertise with MS Office: Excel, Access, Word, and PowerPoint, as well as other grant writing automated systems. Demonstrated skill in math and accurate accounting practices. Must be adept with fiscal tools. Demonstrated skill in setting up and maintaining accurate filing systems.
Ability to maintain independent judgment; strong organization and communication skills; and a customer service focus across broad and diverse subject areas. Ability to anticipate and fulfill customer needs, autonomy, and initiative. Demonstrated problem-solving and organizational skills, with a demonstrated ability to exercise discretion to solve problems. The employee must be trustworthy and ethical and exhibit a high degree of integrity. Ability to deliver consistently high levels of customer service at all times, and develop successful relationships with both CMM and non-CMM faculty and support staff.
Maintains current knowledge of compliance regulations in all areas of research administration.
Demonstrated knowledge of generally accepted accounting, fiscal and reporting principles.
Demonstrated extramural research proposal preparation with emphasis on NIH and other Health Sciences related funders. Demonstrated expertise in the preparation of all sponsors and funding mechanisms.
Ability to independently interpret and implement appropriate UCSD and agency policies, procedures, and guidelines.
Familiarity with Department and Central office staff, student, and laboratory contacts involved in the preparation of proposals.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge of the Personnel Payroll System (PPS) policies and procedures.
Competent with UCSD information systems that promote excellent fund management.
Experience with UCSD online and web-based accounting systems (IFIS, FinancialLink, etc.)
Five (5) years of experience.
SPECIAL CONDITIONS
Job offer is contingent upon satisfactory clearance based on Background Check results.
Pay Transparency Act
Annual Full Pay Range: $69,500 - $123,500 (will be prorated if the appointment percentage is less than 100%)
Hourly Equivalent: $33.29 - $59.15
Factors in determining the appropriate compensation for a role include experience, skills, knowledge, abilities, education, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The Hiring Pay Scale referenced in the job posting is the budgeted salary or hourly range that the University reasonably expects to pay for this position. The Annual Full Pay Range may be broader than what the University anticipates to pay for this position, based on internal equity, budget, and collective bargaining agreements (when applicable).


If employed by the University of California, you will be required to comply with our Policy on Vaccination Programs, which may be amended or revised from time to time. Federal, state, or local public health directives may impose additional requirements.

If applicable, life-support certifications (BLS, NRP, ACLS, etc.) must include hands-on practice and in-person skills assessment; online-only certification is not acceptable.

UC San Diego Health Sciences is comprised of our School of Medicine, Skaggs School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, The Herbert Wertheim School of Public Health and Human Longevity Science, and our Student Health and Well-Being Department. We have long been at the forefront of translational - or "bench-to-bedside" - research, transforming patient care through discovery and innovation leading to new drugs and technologies. Translational research is carried out every day in the hundreds of clinical trials of promising new therapies offered through UC San Diego Health, and in the drive of our researchers and clinician-scientists who are committed to having a significant impact on patient care. We invite you to join our team!
Applications/Resumes are accepted for current job openings only. For full consideration on any job, applications must be received prior to the initial closing date. If a job has an extended deadline, applications/resumes will be considered during the extension period; however, a job may be filled before the extended date is reached.
To foster the best possible working and learning environment, UC San Diego strives to cultivate a rich and diverse environment, inclusive and supportive of all students, faculty, staff and visitors. For more information, please visit UC San Diego Principles of Community.
UC San Diego is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age or protected veteran status.

For the University of California’s Anti-Discrimination Policy, please visit: https://policy.ucop.edu/doc/1001004/Anti-Discrimination

title: Financial Analyst

description:
Position Details
Position Information
Recruitment/Posting Title
Senior Financial Analyst I

Job Category
Staff & Executive - Finance/Accounting/Purchasing

Department
CINJ-Finance

Overview
Through our science, our evidence-based actions, our openness, and our respect for those we serve, we will advance cancer-focused research worldwide and reduce the burden of cancer in our catchment area. By engaging with and empowering our exceptionally diverse populations, and addressing their questions and fears, we will engender hope for cancer patients and their families and play a critical role in strengthening the fabric of our communities by gaining and
protecting their trust and providing access to the outstanding oncology care each person deserves.
Our mission is to accelerate scientific discovery focused on understanding cancer, innovating cancer treatment, and improving cancer prevention; to provide outstanding, novel, and compassionate patient care; to provide evidence-based and culturally informed education to physicians, nurses, researchers, staff, and the community; and to achieve cancer health equity in our state through outreach to and engagement of our extraordinarily diverse communities.
Curiosity and Discovery, Integrity, Collaboration, Cultivating Diversity, Respect and Caring, Perseverance.

Posting Summary
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Senior Financial Analyst I within the Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey.

The primary purpose of Senior Financial Analyst I (Grants and Contracts) is to provide research specific support and guidance to Principal Investigator’s basic research post administration of contracts. The role is to safeguard Rutgers Cancer Institute contract resources and determine appropriate allocability and allowability in the daily administration of study budgets, maintenance of documentations from the initial and final end of contracts related to financial aspects of project accounts.

Among the key duties for this position are the following:
Responsible for the post award administration and coordination of assigned clinical trials, grants and contracts for research and other non-sponsored programs.
Monitors incoming revenue, runs and maintains cash receipts report and works closely with internal/external entities to obtain corresponding payment details to ensure timely posting of payments.
Quantitative and financial analysis of complex spreadsheet from Oracle diverse financial system to provide timely and insightful analysis of projects.
Assists with conducting monthly variance analysis, budget and forecast projections, and other financial reporting such as preparation of comprehensive P&L statements.
Not just limited to Corporate research contracts but also include federal and state and other sponsored agencies to ensure posting of accurate journal entries to the sub and general ledger.
Works diligently to collaborate with Research Financial Services (RFS) central Grant Specialists in the reconciliation of billings arising from all sources of Grants and Contract research sponsored programs.
Maintains financial analysis template to ensure allocation of cost and payment from sponsored programs are allowable and allocable.
Reviews and approves Marketplace requisitions, reconciles and maintains Purchase Orders for associated clinical research services, performs adjusting entries as needed to post costs to project accounts, and provides responses to inquiries relates to contract awards.
Submits salary and fringe relief cost transfers and budget allocation through journal entry by cost center in Oracle Financial system.

Full Time

Daily Work Shift

Work Arrangement
Consistent with the current application of Rutgers Policy 60.3.22 or the applicable provisions of relevant collective negotiations agreements, this position may be eligible for a hybrid work arrangement. Flexible work arrangements are not permanent, are subject to change or discontinuation, and contingent on the employee receiving approval in the FlexWork@RU Application System.

Position Pension Eligibility
ABP

Qualifications
Minimum Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in a Finance, Accounting, Business or related field required.
Four (4) years of related experience required.
Equivalent experience, education and/or training may be substituted for the education requirements.

Certifications/Licenses

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Knowledge and experience with journal entries, financial statement reporting, and general accounting (GAAP) concepts are also required.
Strong financial experience of industry-sponsored and non-industry sponsored clinical trials.
The ideal candidate will have accounting skills, be detail oriented, have excellent organizational skills, be able to prioritize, multitask, be proficient in computer applications at an advanced level, MS Word, Excel, possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills, be able to maximize resources and be resourceful.
Advanced skill level in database and reporting tools such as Microsoft Excel required, including chart development, V-Lookups and Pivot Tables.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience in Basic Research environment within a healthcare or academic organization preferred.
Experience at a non-profit and/or higher education medical center is preferred.
Experience with OnCore® CTMS preferred.
Knowledge of CPT coding and EPIC research billing is preferred.

title: Financial Analyst

description:
The Financial Analyst will provide analytical support to the BNI Operations Team. You will research internal and external business trends, summarize, and track key data in order to provide meaningful analysis and help in preparation of presentations to the senior and executive management team. This is a key position, with interaction at all levels, which requires excellent communication skills, both written and oral, superior analytical, problem-solving and modeling skills and exceptional PC skills.
Essential Duties
Researching, tracking and summarizing key data, including, trends, profitability and expense analyses.
Data analysis and maintenance for portfolio review.
Assisting finance team with analyzing business results for key takeaways.
Expected to help create new approaches for data analysis and presentation to senior and executive management – ideally in Power BI, Excel and EPM platforms
Development of non-routine reports and presentations to Senior Management; use of current technology to produce, deliver, and distribute reports and analysis.
Reporting and analysis related to annual budget and quarterly forecasting process.
Contributing to the month-end close process and performing ad-hoc projects and analysis.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business, Finance, or Economics. MBA or CPA a plus.
Must have a minimum of two (2) year of business or financial analysis experience required preferably in a dynamic environment.
Excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.
Advance knowledge of Microsoft Office 2007 or higher, specifically Excel.
Must be able to create detailed worksheets.
Skills in Power BI, Hyperion, EPM would be a plus.
Ability to take direction from supervisors, and aggressively contribute to departmental discussions regarding problem solving.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, dynamic, results-oriented environment.
Pay: $57,000 - $82,000
The pay listed is the salary range for this position, an estimate and not guaranteed. Any specific offer will vary based on applicant’s experience, skills, abilities, geographic location, and alignment with market data.

ABM offers a comprehensive benefits package. For information about ABM’s benefits, visit ABM 2024 Employee Benefits | Staff & Management

description:
Description:
Interclypse is hiring to support a federal client responsible for disbursements, management and coordination of planning, budgeting, analysis, acquisitions, risk management, program evaluation, and performance management functions. Specifically, this opportunity is for loan accounting support because of additional legislation to support the economic infrastructure of small businesses since March 2020 (pandemic known as Coronavirus Disease 2019). This position is onsite in Denver, Colorado.
Responsibilities will consist of, but not limited to, the following:
Provide support for transcripts of accounts that are used for court, payoffs, borrower disputes, and other critical operations activities. Support might include both manual and automated processes with reconciliation or journal vouchers.
Manage incoming items and assign workload out of the action desk to staff. Must be able to analyze and properly code a wide variety of requests from internal departments, service offices, and lenders.
Assist in clearing complex accounts payable, consisting of overpayments of balances or miscellaneous refunds to borrowers, lenders, and external parties.
Review and confirm accounts payable information to ensure that improper payments are not made.
Conduct research to validate that collections are recorded to correct loan and accounts.
Record collections, expenses, and/or fees to the loans with a journal voucher when the system is unable to post through automation.
Complete service office requests for loan adjustments. May require any combination of a journal voucher, transcript, field updates, research, retrieval of documents, invoice, refund, or detailed written response.
Expectation of 10-15 completed customer service requests or clearing of 25-30 suspense items on an average day. Other duties or lack of other duties may decrease or increase this expectation.
Develop and update desk guides and other process documents.
Provide support for back office research into loan and account corrections.
Distribute work across contracting team members.
Maintain and submit deliverables to the Government.
Communicate issues regarding work assignments or contractor personnel to Government.
Requirements:
At least 3 years relevant experience
Bachelor's degree in accounting, or related business field

description:
Summary

Posted: Sep 12, 2024

Role Number:200567619

Imagine what you can do here. Apple is a place where extraordinary people gather to do their lives best work. Together we create products and experiences people once couldn’t have imagined, and now, can’t imagine living without. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do.

Description

APPLE INC has the following available in Cupertino, California and various unanticipated locations throughout the USA. Manage WW AppleCare Warranty and Quality Program accrual balances, track Freight Warranty spend, generate Claims Forecasts, submit Transfer Pricing deliverables to Corporate, and various other warranty related initiatives impacting worldwide reporting. Utilize accounting knowledge and skills to provide monthly forecast and quarterly activities for Warranty, Quality Programs, and Freight, such as booking entries, accruals, and completing reconciliations. Fulfill quarterly requirements for transfer pricing forecasts submitted to Corporate FP&A. Based on knowledge of SAP, reengineer multiple business processes in the Quality Program space and implement automation initiatives for both our team and our regional counterparts in EMEA and APAC. Forecast expected future claims in Warranty, Quality Programs, and Freight, based on historical actuals, seasonal deviations, and other uplift factors. Resolve issues by collaborating cross-functionally with teams in AppleCare Business Intelligence (ACBI) and GBS, and providing guidance on financial transactions. Lead and coordinate the execution of all AppleCare Finance internal controls on a quarterly basis in adherence to Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) parameters. Take on role as SOX walkthrough coordinator to be single point of contact between AppleCare Finance teams and external auditors. Complete all statutory audit requests that need to be completed and submitted to our regional counterparts in EMEA and APAC. 40 hours/week. At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $139,443 - $201,300/yr and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. PAY & BENEFITS: Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses - including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits: https://www.apple.com/careers/us/benefits.html. Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program. Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.
Master's degree or foreign equivalent in Accounting, Finance or related field and 3 years of experience in the job offered or related occupation.
3 years of experience with each of the following skills is required:
Financial modeling of forecasts to estimate and predict future spend and activity. These models must take into account historical data along with seasonality trends and regional factors that drive variability across different regions in the world
SAP experience and understanding in order to extract data quickly and efficiently
Accounting knowledge in order to have meaningful discussions across the Finance organization and to be able to complete accounting based tasks such as booking journal entries, maintaining proper accrual balances, and reconciling GL accounts
Audit experience - experience collaborating with external auditors as well as internal business assurance and compliance teams
Use Tableau to prepare quarter close and forecasts and present to finance leadership
Use Excel to complete analysis including financial activity, expertise in advanced knowledge of various formulas and shortcuts in Excel
Presenting in front of a wide variety of audiences (e.g. peers, managers, senior leadership, etc.) for articulating the financial impact of changes in the business during the quarter

Preferred Qualifications
n/a

Education & Experience

Additional Requirements

More

description:
Thank you for your interest in working at William Paterson University.
Under the direction of a Professional Services Specialist 2 or higher supervisory officer in the Administrative Services area in the Office of the Controller at William Paterson University, the Financial Analyst (State Title - Professional Services Specialist 3) is responsible for independently performing professional work of greater difficulty using established policies, procedures, precedents, and guidelines; does related work as required.
EXAMPLES OF WORK:
Reviews and interprets applicable principles, federal and/or state laws and regulations in the course of official duties.
Participates in the selection of and may assign and review the work of clericals, part-time, and/or student workers.
Assigns and monitors the work of students and/or staff, identifies problem areas, and provides suggestions for improvement.

title: Financial Analyst

description:
About the Role & Team
Disneyland Resort (DLR) Finance and Revenue Management & Analytics is looking for a forward-thinking team leader who is passionate about delivering quality results and enjoys working closely with commercial partners across the Disneyland Resort on both strategic and tactical challenges.
As an SFA on the Disneyland Resort Sales Finance team, this candidate will use technology, data analytics, and optimization to explore opportunities, shape business decisions, and drive business results. The Sales Analyst role is responsible for managing sales data warehouses across all Walt Disney Domestic Parks & Resorts. The Analyst will serve as the domain expert on sales data, metrics, and the source systems that feed sales data warehouses. The role will focus on continuous improvement of the reporting tools and processes and will be a key partner in reporting projects that span multiple customers.
A successful candidate will have strong analytical skills, critical thinking, ability to communicate across cross-business teams of technology and business leaders, as well as solid partnering and analytical skills, including problem solving and meeting key deadlines in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate would be a dynamic and flexible who can excel in building relationships, adapting to new systems and projects and getting results.
What You Will Do
Responsible for the integrity of sales data used in executive reviews, analysis, and ongoing performance & incentive reporting. Perform ongoing data quality activities and analysis on large datasets with complex data flows across multiple systems.
Identify and implement more efficient and streamlined reporting processes using various tools such as Snowflake, Tableau, etc. along with managing sales data warehouses structures.
Work on multi-functional project teams to provide requirements, testing, and training for system replacements or upgrades. Project teams usually include the Sales operations team, Technology, Sales Analytics & Insights, and Financial Systems.
Reconcile Domestic Park & Resorts key metrics
Required Qualifications & Skills
2+ years of experience in accounting, analytics, or data mining.
Proficiency in database and reporting tools such as SAP, Microsoft Excel, MircoStrategy, Business Objects.
Ability to collaborate with multiple customers to identify areas that data and analytics can contribute to the business.
Ability to effectively partner across all levels and manage multiple projects.
Preferred Qualifications
Knowledge of and experience with databases, online data management skills, and data warehousing practices.
Working knowledge of Tableau, Python, Power BI, and Snowflake.
Education
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with concentration in Accounting, Business, Finance, Data Analysis, Engineering, or similar field
Disability accommodation for employment applications
The Walt Disney Company and its Affiliated Companies are Equal Employment Opportunity employers and welcome all job seekers including individuals with disabilities and veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or apply for a position, email Candidate.Accommodations@Disney.com with your request. This email address is not for general employment inquiries or correspondence. We will only respond to those requests that are related to the accessibility of the online application system due to a disability.
The Walt Disney Company is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Disney champions a business environment where ideas and decisions from all people help us grow, innovate, create the best stories and be relevant in a constantly evolving world.

The hiring range for this position in California is $101,800.00 to $124,400.00 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

The Office of Philanthropy & Alumni Engagement is seeking a qualified Gift Processing Team Lead. The Gift Processing Team Lead will report to the Associate Director of Gift Receiving and is specifically responsible for assisting with planning and coordinating the prompt and accurate processing of all gifts made to the University of Kentucky. Gift Administration responsibilities include managing payroll/ACH gift enrollments and Athletics/WUKY/One Day gift file analysis and processing workflows. Pledge and future commitment processing responsibilities include recording all pledges and future commitments, tracking complex commitments to support comprehensive pledge reporting to college/units/UFS and working collaboratively with Pledge and Gift Administration Specialist to support ongoing/annual reporting requirements. The Gift Processing Team Lead will work cooperatively as a member of the Gift Receiving team to promote a positive work environment and model excellent customer service.

description:
Position: Financial Analyst (Remote-East Coast USA)
Job Description
Financial analyst role for a private equity sponsored leading medical device company. The role will support both the CFO, Finance and Accounting functions, and play an important role in supporting business leaders in their respective areas.

Location
Remote / East Coast USA.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Analyze historical data, trends, and business drivers to produce accurate and insightful forecasts to support business planning and decision-making.
Assist in producing month / quarter / annual financial statements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including operations, sales, and finance to gather data, understand business drivers, and support strategic initiatives.
Explain and understand financial performance, including variance analysis and trend identification, and provide actionable insights to management.
Partner with cross-functional teams to develop annual budgets, forecasts, and long-range financial plans.
Monitor department budgets, provide support to department leaders to understand variance to plan and prior year.
Conduct ad-hoc financial analysis to support strategic initiatives and decision-making processes.
Identify opportunities to streamline processes, improve efficiency, and enhance the quality of financial reporting and analysis.
Support month-end close processes, including journal entries and reconciliations.
The opportunity to self-direct and manage multiple projects simultaneously to successful completion in a deadline driven environment.
Work in matrix reporting environment.
Exercising your oral and written communication skills at all levels of the organization.

Education and/or Experience:
BA in Accounting or Finance.
Minimum of 2 years of financial planning and analysis experience.
Experience developing corporate financial budgets and forecasting on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.
Extensive Excel knowledge and hands-on experience using the following applications: Adaptive Planning, Oracle Business, Hyperion, OBIEE, or similar ERP/BI systems.

Compensation and Benefits: Along with a competitive salary and bonus structure, we offer a comprehensive benefit package: Healthcare Benefits that kick in Day 1, 401k Company contributions, 7 paid holidays + 2 floaters, 4 weeks accrued PTO, and up to $5,000 tuition reimbursement annually. Onside work location in Schaumburg, Illinois, North America.

We are PASSIONATE about:
Natus Medical Incorporated is recognized by healthcare providers globally as the source for solutions to screen, diagnose and treat disorders of the brain, neural pathways and sensory nervous system. Our vision is to deliver innovative and trusted solutions to advance the standard of care and improve patient outcomes and quality of life. Natus products are used in hospitals, clinics and laboratories worldwide.

EEO Statement: Natus Medical is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.

description:

This position assists in the preparation of economic and financial analysis and forecasts for use in the development of financial business decisions.

Performs economic and financial research and analyzes internal and external issues related to sales, gross margin, rate of return, working capital, investment, financial performance, and other financial metrics
Compiles or prepares reports, graphs and charts of developed data

Gathers and correlates basic information using established and defined financial procedures

This position typically reports to a Senior Financial Analyst.This position typically has no direct reports.Typically requires some persuasion or influencing of others.Typically procedures for analyzing situations and making conclusions are very diverse.Typically considers among many different options or procedures when solving problems.Typically progress or results of work is periodically checked. Has some leeway to change work procedures.

Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.

description:
The Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) division is seeking a Financial Analyst IV – FP&A to join the team. This position will prepare and analyze financial performance data to monitor variances, identify trends and provide improvement recommendations.
This position requires an in-depth financial knowledge as the candidate selected will serve as Subject Matter Expert (SME) on key projects, requires very strong analytical and communication skills, and will utilize FP&A concepts such as forecasting and predictive modeling to identify root causes to improve forecasting accuracy and monitor accuracy and predictive validity of existing models. Knowledge of advanced statistical, mathematical, and market research techniques is utilized to predict future outcomes for planning purposes.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance or related field
5+ years in FP&A, Finance, Accounting, or similar field, including work with financial forecasting, data modeling or data science
Must meet minimum standards for grade 66 to be eligible for promotion to this grade

description:
Workwear Outfitters has a strong legacy of building innovative and authentic market-right products and is a leading supplier of work apparel and footwear for diverse occupations in industries such as automotive, manufacturing, oil and gas, utilities, government, food services, telecommunications, hospitality, and many more. Workwear Outfitters is based in Nashville, Tennessee with more than 5,800 employees in facilities spanning the globe.
Brands under the Workwear Outfitters umbrella include Red Kap®, Bulwark®, Image Authority®, Kodiak®, Terra®, Walls®, Liberty ®, Work Authority®, Workrite® Fire Service, Chef Designs®, Horace Small®, and CritiCore®. Workwear Outfitters is also the exclusive licensee for Dickies® apparel in the B2B channel.
Our Purpose: “We champion and empower workers who make our world work better”
Major benefits include medical, vision and dental, Life and Disability coverage.
Other benefits included: 401K, Tuition reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program, Flexible Spending Accounts, and many others.
What You Will Do as a Financial Analyst:
The primary responsibility of this position is to support supply chain finance management for total Workwear Outfitters in the development, implementation, coordination and communication of strategic initiatives and business processes. Requires using moderately complex financial analyses and reports. Additionally, this role will be involved in monthly closing and forecasting cycle, annual plan process, long range strategic planning and business scenario modeling.
How You Will Make a Difference:
Prepare and analyze financial forecasts and annual plans.
Participate in monthly closing process which includes variance analysis vs forecast.
Provide management with analytics on current and future changes to cost.
Partner with FP&A to conduct and communicate review of monthly actuals and forecast by brand
Assist with maintenance in various financial systems/databases
Create reporting, tools and presentations supporting the Supply Chain Management team for reviews with Executive Leadership. Provide critical analytical research to support decisions on strategy and improve operations within the Supply Chain. Work closely with Finance and Operations teams in implementing efforts stemming from recommendations.
Identify opportunities to improve performance, propose and drive enhancements in financial and operational analysis and technological tools. Critically review existing business and financial processes and recommend and drive enhancements with business partners.
Skills for Success:
Years of Related Professional Experience: 3 years
Educational/ Position Requirements: BA/BS in Business, Finance, or other related discipline, and a minimum of 3 years of related professional experience.
Financial and performance analysis experience & financial skills required
Must have strong technical skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Outstanding PC skills in Microsoft environment, including database, spreadsheet, word processing and presentation capabilities.
Ability to work closely with the Finance and Operations staffs while driving a results-oriented culture and an atmosphere of accountability
Self-starter, able to handle multiple tasks in a dynamic, team environment while maintaining the highest level of individual accountability
Highly organized & achievement-oriented
Detail-oriented with exceptional analytical skills
